lexUnit.name: recovery.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act or the process of recovering.

sentence.text: After that point , the recovery from widespread disease and the high death-rate was dramatic .
Dons president John Fashanu has suffered his own autumnus horribilis , and his recovery from a hip injury has n't come a moment too soon for manager Joe Kinnear .
Anne made a good recovery from her illness and three weeks later was back in circulation .
What makes this practice abhorrent is the fact that recovery from surgery , as we all know , involves shock , pain , distress , and suffering .
According to the club call Rod Wallace 's recovery from his hamstring injury has speeded up greatly and he is ` in with a good chance " of playing against Battyburn on Sunday .
Bayfield and England captain Will Carling are playing only after making near-miraculous recoveries from injuries against Otago in Dunedin last weekend .
SCHOOLMATES of a young hit and run victim today prayed for the recovery of their soccer-mad pal .
Can you suggest anything to hasten their recovery ?
` So here 's to your full recovery , and a brilliant future , Ginny , darling . "
The significance of the economic recovery , such as it was , in 1977- 8 caused much debate and some perplexity .
She was severely injured but made a full recovery .
The U.S. economy may be on the verge of falling back into recession after more than a year of half-hearted recovery that failed to generate either jobs or hope , according to economists .
